page.title: 05NORMAN THELWELL THE ARTIST
page.content: { Norman Thelwell,}the famous cartoonist, came from the outskirts of Liverpool and has now come to live at Heron's Mead in {Timsbury.} He has written an autobiography and a book about his garden which he has landscaped. The first book he wrote was{Angels on Horseback}which was published in 1955. At that time he was teaching in the Wolverhampton College of Art. Norman Thelwell has published around thirty books. In his school days he says he was only good at art. Norman Thelwell's cartoons are mostly a comment on the relationship between animals and their owners. Mr. Thelwell thought that he would have a lot of competition in this art field but found that no one else concentrated on this subject.
